page.title: 15FARMING - AGRICULTURE
page.content: A survey showed the area to be very mixed in that the following{crops}were in evidence: wherat, barley, oil seed rape, potatoes and sugar beet (which is taken to the British Sugar factory in Newark). The{animals}kept are pigs, which are bred and fattened to bacon weight. They are sold to bacon factories outside the county. Sheep too were in evidence as were beef cattle, but no dairy cattle. {Farming}appeared to be prosperous as new buildings were being erected, some to store grain, some for potato storage and further pig development. Beef cattle are raised intensively - brought to the farm as stores and sold as beef. There was evidence of high mechanisation with new large expensive machinery being used on farms.
